insulate.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to cover or protect something with a material that stops electricity, sound, heat etc from getting in or out
insulate.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Pipes may need insulating against the cold.
insulate.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to keep someone apart from particular experiences or influences, especially unpleasant ones
insulate.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The royal family tried to insulate him from the prying eyes of the media.
insulate.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to keep something safe from the harmful effects of something
insulate.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Such a strategy helps insulate the portfolio from the stock marketâ€™s volatility.
